channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 9th October
item.description:
Pothole In the road Less than 30cm wide & deeper than 4cm
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree too big, 9th October
item.description:
I live on Roselle Drive and there is a tree planted on the pavement about a foot from my garden wall. It is huge, much bigger than other trees nearby. It is overhanging my driveway, my garden and garden wall, and my wall joins are not looking very healthy. I would like to request it is pruned at least but I donâ€™t want to have to pay since it is not my tree. Is this something you can help with? The tree itself is on Linden close as I live on the corner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linden Close, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 9th October
item.description:
Trees Causing damage/obstruction to pavement/road It's lovely having the segregated cycle path up the hill on the A435. But the lane is covered in tree debris. Can you do a road sweep up the cycle lane please

item.title: Damaged tarmac around man hole cover, 9th October
item.description:
On the Tewkesbury outwards from Cheltenham to Tewksbury. Near the turning onto Moor Avenue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen fencing on Napier Drive beside green space, 9th October
item.description:
The fencing which separates the pedestrian walkway and the road access to the parking area (alongside the green space) has fallen down in two different areas - at the end nearest the houses and in a middle section nearer the road. The end section has been like this for several months. The central section has been for about three weeks. Without the fencing there is nothing to prevent vehicles parking on the path or green space which includes a protected oak tree and on which children play.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Napier Drive, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poteholes appearing daily, 9th October
item.description:
Some potholes were marked last week but more are appearing each day. The road is getting really bad
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Yarnolds, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is Dying and a threat, 9th October
item.description:
This tree has been slowing dying for years. Last year it lost a giant limb into the road nearly crushing my car, another small limb has fallen and its clear to see more are dead and close to falling. The only tree on this road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Yarnolds, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: So much rubbish and can't even use the path, 9th October
item.description:
The place looks so filthy, this street must be missed out on the cleaning schedules. Rubbish everywhere and the hedge is so overgrown you can't use the path. Whole path needs jet washing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Gristmill Close, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 9th October
item.description:
06/10/23 email rcvd (subsidence enquiry @ 11437772) - Hi Dawn So does this mean for pruning trees too? As trees are hanging over our fence and touching our house and garage roof which consequently is causing issue with our guttering. We are actually renting the accommodation so will get onto my landlord about the tree roots lifting out patio and cracking the garage and utility room. Be grateful to know if they can be pruned at least please? Regards
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 9th October
item.description:

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 9th October
